alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 25 at 12:44AM EDT until July 25 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Erie County in northwestern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Crawford County in northwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 115 AM EDT. * At 1243 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Corry, or 25 miles west of Warren, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Erie and northeastern Crawford Counties, including the following locations... Spartansburg and Elgin. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
